findings.exploitScenario: An attacker can access /.git/HEAD to gather sensitive information about the application
findings.impact: Information disclosure may lead to further attacks
findings.remediation:
**Remediation:**
Remove the exposed `.git` directory from the web root.

**How it was confirmed:**
Accessed `.git/HEAD` and received a 200 status code.

**How to simulate:**
```bash
curl -I https://juice-shop-vsq1.onrender.com/.git/HEAD
```

**Code Fix:**
```bash
# For Apache, add to .htaccess:
RedirectMatch 404 /\.(git|svn|hg)/
# For Nginx, add to config:
location ~ /\.(git|svn|hg)/ { return 404; }
```

findings.description: Missing security header: HSTS (HTTP Strict Transport Security)
findings.exploitScenario: Add Strict-Transport-Security header with max-age of at least 31536000

findings.description: Missing security header: CSP (Content Security Policy)
findings.exploitScenario: Implement a Content-Security-Policy header to prevent XSS and injection attacks
Add X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block

findings.description: Missing security header: Referrer-Policy (Controls referrer information)
findings.exploitScenario: Add Referrer-Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin

findings.description: Missing security header: Permissions-Policy (Controls browser features)
findings.exploitScenario: Add Permissions-Policy to restrict unnecessary browser features

findings.description: Missing security header: COEP (Cross-Origin Embedder Policy)
findings.exploitScenario: Add Cross-Origin-Embedder-Policy: require-corp

findings.description: Missing security header: COOP (Cross-Origin Opener Policy)
findings.exploitScenario: Add Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy: same-origin

findings.description: Missing security header: CORP (Cross-Origin Resource Policy)
findings.exploitScenario: Add Cross-Origin-Resource-Policy: same-origin

findings.description: Missing security header: X-Permitted-Cross-Domain-Policies (Restricts Flash/PDF cross-domain policy files)
findings.exploitScenario: Add X-Permitted-Cross-Domain-Policies: none

findings.description: CORS policy reflects arbitrary origin or uses wildcard
findings.exploitScenario: Any website can make cross-origin requests to this application

findings.description: Missing HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) header
findings.exploitScenario: Browser does not enforce HTTPS, enabling SSL stripping attacks
findings.impact: Vulnerability to SSL stripping and MITM attacks

findings.description: jQuery v2.2.4 detected in page - jQuery < 3.0 has XSS vulnerabilities (CVE-2020-11022)
findings.exploitScenario: Known vulnerabilities in jQuery 2.2.4 can be exploited
findings.impact: Varies per CVE—XSS, prototype pollution, or DoS
findings.remediation:
**Remediation:**
Upgrade jQuery to version 3.5.0 or later.

**How it was confirmed:**
Pattern "jquery.min.js" with version < 3.5.0 found in response body.

**How to simulate:**
```bash
curl -I https://juice-shop-vsq1.onrender.com/login | grep -i "jquery"
```

**Code fix (JavaScript):**
```javascript
<!-- Replace with -->
<script src="https://code.jquery.com/jquery-3.5.1.min.js"></script>
```

findings.description: External script loaded without Subresource Integrity (SRI)
findings.exploitScenario: If the CDN is compromised, malicious code is executed on all users' browsers
findings.impact: Supply chain attack, arbitrary code execution in user browsers

findings.description: External script loaded without Subresource Integrity (SRI)
findings.exploitScenario: If the CDN is compromised, malicious code is executed on all users' browsers
findings.impact: Supply chain attack, arbitrary code execution in user browsers
findings.remediation:
**Remediation:**
Add SRI to the script tag: `<script src="//cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/jquery/2.2.4/jquery.min.js" integrity="sha384-KJ3o2DKtIkvYIK3UENzmM7KCkRr/rE9/Qpg6aAZGJwFDMVNA/GpGFF93hXpG5KkN" crossorigin="anonymous"></script>`

**How it was confirmed:**
Inspected the source code of the endpoint and found the script tag without SRI.

**How to simulate:**
```bash
curl -I https://juice-shop-vsq1.onrender.com/login | grep -i "jquery.min.js"
```

**Code Fix:**
```javascript
// Before
<script src="//cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/jquery/2.2.4/jquery.min.js"></script>

// After
<script src="//cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/jquery/2.2.4/jquery.min.js" integrity="sha384-KJ3o2DKtIkvYIK3UENzmM7KCkRr/rE9/Qpg6aAZGJwFDMVNA/GpGFF93hXpG5KkN" crossorigin="anonymous"></script>
```

findings.exploitScenario: Compromised CDN can inject CSS-based attacks
findings.impact: Data exfiltration via CSS, UI manipulation
findings.remediation:
**Remediation:**
Add SRI to the CSS file in the HTML.

**How it was confirmed:**
Inspected the HTML source and found the `<link>` tag without the `integrity` attribute.

**How to simulate:**
```bash
curl -I https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/cookieconsent2/3.1.0/cookieconsent.min.css
```

**Code Fix:**
```html
<link href="//cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/cookieconsent2/3.1.0/cookieconsent.min.css"
  rel="stylesheet"
  integrity="sha384-..."
  crossorigin="anonymous">
```

findings.description: No rate limiting detected on rapid requests
findings.evidence: 5 rapid requests all returned non-429 responses
findings.exploitScenario: Attacker can brute-force endpoints without being rate-limited or detected
findings.impact: Enables brute force, enumeration, and DoS attacks
findings.remediation:
**Remediation:**
Implement rate limiting middleware to restrict requests to 5 per minute.

**How it was confirmed:**
`curl -i -X GET https://juice-shop-vsq1.onrender.com -H "Host: juice-shop-vsq1.onrender.com" -H "Connection: keep-alive"` executed 5 times in rapid succession returned non-429 responses.

**How to simulate:**
`for i in {1..6}; do curl -s -o /dev/null -w "%{http_code}" https://juice-shop-vsq1.onrender.com; done`

**Code Fix (Express.js):**
```javascript
const rateLimit = require('express-rate-limit');
app.use(rateLimit({
  windowMs: 60 * 1000, // 1 minute
  max: 5 // limit each IP to 5 requests per windowMs
}));
```

recommendations: 7 high-severity issues should be resolved before deployment.
Add all recommended security headers (CSP, HSTS, X-Frame-Options, etc.).
